availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Phillip Doern (Louisville, Kentucky, editor of the "Anzeiger")

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper editor. Native of Germany. Son of George W. Doern and Elizabeth Doern. Married to Barbara Tomppert Doern in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on October 2, 1851. Father of Ophelia Doern, Elizabeth Doern, and Lisette Doern. Founded the Anzeiger with Otto Scheefer in Louisville on March 1, 1849. Type setter in Louisville in 1850. Editor of the Anzeiger from 1849 through 1865. Justice of the peace in Jefferson County in 1865.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482707.

The City of Louisville and a Glimpse of Kentucky, (Committee on Industrial and Commercial Improvement of the Louisville Board of Trade, 1887), 144.
